intro: Cathestecum annuum, commonly known as the common pepper plant, is a member of the Solanaceae family. It is a herbaceous annual plant that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers that develop into the familiar red, orange, or yellow fruits. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. The plant is native to Central and South America but is now widely cultivated around the world for its edible fruits.
